alert.note: Alert for Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 5:09AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT LOCATIONS NORTHEAST OF MAYER IN YAVAPAI COUNTY THROUGH 545 AM MST... At 507 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Powell Springs CG, or 12 miles southwest of Camp Verde, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Camp Verde, Verde Village, Mcguireville, Cherry, Beaverhead Flat, Montezuma Castle National Monument, McGuireville, Hayfield Draw OHV Area, Bridgeport, Fort Verde State Historic Park, Mormons Crossing Swimming Hole, Montezuma Well, Montezuma Castle N.M., Middle Verde, Flower Pot, Jordan, Powell Springs CG, House Mountain Trail Lookout, Verde Valley Ryal Canyon Trailhead, and Bignotti. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 266 and 299. State Route 260 between mile markers 207 and 221. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 301. State Route 89A between mile markers 353 and 364. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
